comment._content:
These are basket-case Third World poverty conditions . . . there were apparently parallel universes going on in one country. 

One half (white) appears to be mass-producing aircraft with which to combat evil and tyranny abroad in Europe and Asia; the other (black) half are living in the evil of poverty and tyranny of discrimination at home. 

What can be acknowledged overseas as evil may be un-acknowledgeable at home?

comment.author: 38371584@N00
comment._content:
pleroma - in certain parts of the USA, there is still third world poverty today. 

It's much more startling in 2008 to see people living in squalor than it was to see this type of thing at the tail end of the Depression.

comment.author: 45791749@N00
comment._content: I was astonished when in the early 90s I came to the USA and saw this home grown degradation for my own eyes.  Coming from Europe I'd only seen relatively positive images of American prosperity and power in the media: this was the can-do superpower that had landed men on the moon . . . .  And yet it couldn't take care of its own people adequately.

comment.author: 60861613@N00
comment._content: It still can't. We're a first world nation with large third world areas.

comment._content: Yes. A subtle, but important distinction.
